ground_truth: Harry holds out a hand, and Peter clasps it firmly. Harry nods, and Peter gets to his feet. They spin round to face their enemies. Venom flies at Peter. Harry swings Peter like a club to hit Sandman. He blasts Sandman's arm with flames from his sky stick. Sandman tries to grab Harry, but the monster's huge arm shatters like glass. Jameson's in the crowd below. He tries to take a photograph. The camera's empty. Jameson glares at the girl. Peter and Harry duck Sandman's huge fists. Above them, the cab plummets towards Mary Jane. The cab misses her. She hangs on by a thread. Harry and Peter fly towards her on the sky stick, weaving past the sandy hulk. The thread breaks, and Mary Jane tumbles. Peter slues the sky stick round. Being onto each other, they surf past Sandman, and Peter leaps off the sky stick and catches her. The watching crowd go wild as he swings away on a thread carrying Mary Jane in his arms and lands back on the half-built skyscraper. He nods through his torn mask. Sandman grabs at Harry. Peter kicks sand in Sandman's eyes. Sandman lumbers round, bemused, then punches Peter with his massive arm, sending him flying up to one of the upper floors of the half-completed building. He's out of Sandman's reach. He fires rockets from the sky stick. They hit their target, and the enormous sand creature staggers back, crumbling and disintegrating. As his huge left arm crumples into the ground leaving out of dust, the crowd whoop their delight. High up on the skyscraper, Peter, his Spider-Man mask badly torn, his eye and mouth quite visible, looks around for Venom. As Peter turns his way and that, Venom grabs him from above and hurls him into a girder. Peter falls on his face. Venom lassos his wrists with two black threads and holds him to his knees. He whacks him with an iron bar. He hits him twice more, ripping the mask right off. Venom holds the jagged metal bar to Peter's neck. Venom's tendrils engulf Brock's face. As he goes to stab Peter, a pumpkin bomb cuts into him. Harry flies up. Venom snatches the sky stick from under him. As Harry falls, he gets a rack of long metal tubes that fall to the floor. Peter still trapped watches as Venom puts his hands to his ears and seems to half-disintegrate. Peter remembers hitting himself on the bell when he tried to tear the black suit off. Venom leaps down Peter, wielding the sky stick as a weapon. Harry steps in between them. Harry looks down at the two blades protruding through his chest. Venom hoists him up into the air and tosses him away.

test_cases.name: Synonym Substitution
test_cases.description:
Certainly! Here is the transformed text with exact synonyms:

Harry grips out a hand, and Peter seizes it securely. Harry bobs, and Peter rises to his feet. They whirl round to confront their adversaries. Venom darts at Peter. Harry swings Peter like a cudgel to strike Sandman. He blasts Sandman's limb with infernos from his sky stick. Sandman attempts to clutch Harry, but the monster's colossal limb shatters like crystal. Jameson's in the throng below. He attempts to capture a photo. The camera's vacant. Jameson scowls at the girl. Peter and Harry evade Sandman's colossal fists. Above them, the cab plunges towards Mary Jane. The cab bypasses her. She clings on by a strand. Harry and Peter soar towards her on the sky stick, weaving past the sandy giant. The strand snaps, and Mary Jane plunges. Peter spins the sky stick round. Being onto each other, they glide past Sandman, and Peter jumps off the sky stick and snatches her. The watching throng goes wild as he swings away on a strand carrying Mary Jane in his arms and lands back on the half-constructed skyscraper. He bobs through his torn mask. Sandman grabs at Harry. Peter kicks grit in Sandman's eyes. Sandman lumbers round, befuddled, then strikes Peter with his gigantic limb, sending him soaring up to one of the upper stories of the half-completed structure. He's out of Sandman's reach. He fires missiles from the sky stick. They strike their mark, and the immense sand behemoth staggers back, crumbling and decaying. As his gigantic left limb collapses into the ground leaving out of dust, the throng whoops their joy. High up on the skyscraper, Peter, his Spider-Man mask badly torn, his eye and mouth quite visible, looks around for Venom. As Peter turns his way and that, Venom seizes him from above and hurls him into a beam. Peter falls on his visage. Venom lassos his wrists with two black strands and holds him to his knees. He whacks him with a steel rod. He strikes him twice more, ripping the mask right off. Venom holds the jagged metallic rod to Peter's throat. Venom's tendrils engulf Brock's visage. As he goes to stab Peter, a pumpkin explosive slices into him. Harry soars up. Venom seizes the sky stick from under him. As Harry falls, he gets a rack of lengthy metallic tubes that drop to the surface. Peter still trapped watches as Venom puts his hands to his ears and seems to half-disintegrate. Peter remembers hitting himself on the bell when he tried to tear the black suit off. Venom leaps down Peter, wielding the sky stick as a weapon. Harry steps in between them. Harry looks down at the two blades protruding through his torso. Venom hoists him up into the air and hurls him away.

test_cases.name: Brevity - L1
test_cases.description: Harry extends a hand, and Peter grips it firmly, nodding as he stands. They turn to face their foes. Venom lunges at Peter, while Harry swings him like a club to strike Sandman, blasting Sandman's arm with flames from his sky stick. Sandman attempts to grab Harry, but his massive arm shatters. In the crowd below, Jameson tries to photograph but finds his camera empty, glaring at the girl. Peter and Harry dodge Sandman's huge fists. Above, a cab plummets toward Mary Jane but misses her. She clings by a thread. Harry and Peter fly to her on the sky stick, weaving past Sandman. The thread snaps, and Mary Jane falls. Peter maneuvers the sky stick, surfing past Sandman, and leaps to catch her. The crowd cheers as he swings away with Mary Jane, landing on a half-built skyscraper. He nods through his torn mask. Sandman grabs at Harry, but Peter kicks sand in Sandman's eyes. Sandman, confused, punches Peter, sending him to an upper floor, out of reach. Peter fires rockets from the sky stick, hitting Sandman, who crumbles and disintegrates. The crowd cheers. High on the skyscraper, Peter, with his torn Spider-Man mask, searches for Venom. Venom grabs him from above, hurling him into a girder. Peter falls, and Venom lassos his wrists, holding him to his knees, striking him with an iron bar, ripping off the mask. Venom holds a jagged bar to Peter's neck. Venom's tendrils engulf Brock's face. As he moves to stab Peter, a pumpkin bomb hits him. Harry flies up, but Venom snatches the sky stick, causing Harry to fall. Peter, still trapped, watches as Venom covers his ears and partially disintegrates. Peter recalls hitting the bell to remove the black suit. Venom leaps at Peter with the sky stick. Harry intervenes, but Venom impales him with blades and tosses him aside.

test_cases.name: Brevity - L2
test_cases.description: Harry extends a hand, and Peter grips it firmly, standing up. They turn to face their foes. Venom attacks Peter. Harry swings Peter to hit Sandman, then blasts Sandman's arm with flames from his sky stick. Sandman tries to grab Harry, but his arm shatters. Jameson, in the crowd, attempts a photo, but his camera is empty. Peter and Harry dodge Sandman's fists. Above, a cab falls towards Mary Jane but misses. She clings by a thread. Harry and Peter fly to her on the sky stick, dodging Sandman. The thread breaks, and Mary Jane falls. Peter maneuvers the sky stick, leaps, and catches her. The crowd cheers as he swings away with Mary Jane, landing on a skyscraper. He nods through his torn mask. Sandman grabs Harry, but Peter kicks sand in Sandman's eyes. Sandman, confused, punches Peter, sending him to an upper floor. Out of reach, Peter fires rockets from the sky stick, hitting Sandman, who crumbles. The crowd cheers. On the skyscraper, Peter, mask torn, searches for Venom. Venom grabs and hurls him into a girder, then lassos his wrists, hitting him with an iron bar, ripping off the mask. Venom holds a metal bar to Peter's neck. As Venom attacks, a pumpkin bomb hits him. Harry flies up, but Venom takes the sky stick. As Harry falls, metal tubes drop. Peter, trapped, watches Venom half-disintegrate. Venom attacks with the sky stick, but Harry intervenes. Harry is stabbed and thrown away by Venom.

test_cases.name: Verbosity - L1
test_cases.description: Harry extends his hand outward, and Peter grasps it with a firm, resolute grip. Harry gives a nod of acknowledgment, and Peter rises to his feet. Together, they swiftly spin around to confront their adversaries. Venom launches himself at Peter with ferocity. In a swift motion, Harry swings Peter like a club to strike Sandman. He then unleashes a blast of flames from his sky stick, targeting Sandman's arm. Sandman attempts to seize Harry, but the monster's massive arm shatters into pieces like fragile glass. Down below, Jameson stands amidst the crowd. He attempts to capture the moment with a photograph, only to find his camera empty. Frustrated, Jameson glares at the girl beside him. Meanwhile, Peter and Harry deftly dodge Sandman's enormous fists. Above them, a cab plummets dangerously towards Mary Jane. Miraculously, the cab narrowly misses her, leaving her hanging precariously by a thread. Harry and Peter, aboard the sky stick, fly towards her, skillfully weaving past the sandy giant. The thread snaps, and Mary Jane begins to fall. Peter maneuvers the sky stick around with precision. Clinging to each other, they surf past Sandman, and Peter leaps off the sky stick, catching Mary Jane in mid-air. The crowd below erupts in wild cheers as he swings away on a thread, cradling Mary Jane in his arms, and lands safely back on the half-constructed skyscraper. He nods through his torn mask, acknowledging the crowd. Sandman reaches for Harry, but Peter kicks sand into Sandman's eyes, momentarily blinding him. Sandman, confused, turns around and then punches Peter with his massive arm, sending him hurtling up to one of the upper floors of the unfinished building. Safely out of Sandman's reach, Peter fires rockets from the sky stick. The rockets find their mark, causing the colossal sand creature to stagger backward, crumbling and disintegrating. As his enormous left arm collapses into the ground, leaving only dust behind, the crowd erupts in delight. High above on the skyscraper, Peter, with his Spider-Man mask badly torn, revealing his eye and mouth, scans the area for Venom. As Peter turns this way and that, Venom seizes him from above and hurls him into a girder. Peter lands face-first. Venom ensnares his wrists with two black threads, forcing him to his knees. He strikes him with an iron bar, hitting him twice more, tearing the mask completely off. Venom holds the jagged metal bar menacingly to Peter's neck. Venom's tendrils engulf Brock's face. Just as he prepares to stab Peter, a pumpkin bomb intervenes, cutting into him. Harry ascends, flying up. Venom snatches the sky stick from beneath him. As Harry falls, he grabs a rack of long metal tubes that clatter to the floor. Peter, still trapped, watches as Venom clutches his ears and appears to partially disintegrate. Peter recalls the time he struck himself on the bell while trying to remove the black suit. Venom leaps down towards Peter, wielding the sky stick as a weapon. Harry steps in between them, bravely intervening. Harry looks down at the two blades protruding through his chest. Venom lifts him into the air and callously tosses him aside.

test_cases.name: Verbosity - L2
test_cases.description: Harry extends his hand outward with purposeful intent, and Peter, with equal determination, grasps it with a firm, resolute grip. Harry gives a nod of acknowledgment, signaling understanding and solidarity, and Peter rises to his feet with determination in his eyes. Together, they swiftly spin around, uniting their efforts to confront their looming adversaries. Venom launches himself at Peter with ferocity and force. In one swift, seamless motion, Harry swings Peter like a club to strike at Sandman. He then unleashes a fiery blast from his sky stick, expertly targeting Sandman's arm. Sandman makes an attempt to seize Harry, but the monstrous arm shatters into pieces like fragile glass. Down below, amidst the thronging crowd, Jameson stands, eager to capture the intense moment with a photograph, only to find that his camera is frustratingly empty. In a moment of irritation, Jameson glares at the girl beside him. Meanwhile, Peter and Harry deftly dodge Sandman's enormous, sweeping fists. Above them, a cab plummets dangerously close to Mary Jane. Miraculously, the cab narrowly misses her, leaving her hanging precariously by a thread, her life dangling in the balance. Soaring through the air, Harry and Peter, aboard the sky stick, fly urgently towards her, skillfully weaving past the sandy giant's grasp. The thin thread snaps, and Mary Jane begins to fall helplessly. Peter maneuvers the sky stick with precision, expertly turning around. Clinging to one another, they surf past the towering Sandman, and Peter leaps off the sky stick, catching Mary Jane in mid-air with perfect timing. Below, the crowd erupts in wild, jubilant cheers as he swings away on a thread, cradling Mary Jane protectively in his arms, landing safely back on the half-constructed skyscraper. Through his torn mask, he nods, offering a sign of acknowledgment to the crowd. Sandman reaches for Harry, but Peter deftly kicks sand into Sandman's eyes, momentarily blinding him. In confusion, Sandman turns around and then punches Peter with his massive arm, sending him hurtling upward to one of the upper floors of the unfinished building. Safely out of Sandman's immediate reach, Peter fires rockets from the sky stick. The rockets find their mark with precision, causing the colossal sand creature to stagger backward, crumbling and disintegrating into grains. As his enormous left arm collapses into the ground, leaving only dust behind, the crowd erupts in delighted applause. High above on the towering skyscraper, Peter, with his Spider-Man mask badly torn, revealing his eye and mouth, scans the chaotic area for Venom. As Peter turns this way and that, Venom seizes him from above, hurling him into a girder. Peter lands face-first, disoriented. Venom ensnares his wrists with two black, binding threads, forcing him to his knees. He strikes him with an iron bar, hitting him twice more, completely tearing the mask off. Venom holds the jagged metal bar menacingly to Peter's neck, his intent clear. Venom's tendrils engulf Brock's face ominously. Just as he prepares to stab Peter, a timely pumpkin bomb intervenes, cutting into him with precision. Harry ascends, flying upward courageously. Venom snatches the sky stick from beneath his feet. As Harry falls through the air, he grabs onto a rack of long metal tubes that clatter to the floor below. Peter, still trapped and watching helplessly, sees Venom clutching his ears, appearing to partially disintegrate. Peter recalls the time he struck himself on the bell, desperately trying to remove the black suit. Venom leaps down towards Peter, wielding the sky stick as a dangerous weapon. Harry steps in between them, bravely putting himself in harm's way. Harry looks down at the two blades protruding through his chest, unable to comprehend the extent of his sacrifice. Venom lifts him into the air with ruthless disdain, callously tossing him aside like a rag doll.

test_cases.name: Macro-Actions -> Micro-Actions
test_cases.description: Harry extends his hand outward, offering it to Peter, who responds by clasping it firmly, creating a moment of solidarity between them. Harry acknowledges this connection with a nod, prompting Peter to rise to his feet with determination. Together, they pivot swiftly, turning to confront their adversaries head-on. In a sudden burst of action, Venom launches himself toward Peter with aggressive intent. Reacting quickly, Harry seizes Peter and swings him with force, using him like a club to strike Sandman. In a seamless motion, Harry unleashes a fiery blast from his sky stick, directing the flames at Sandman's arm. Sandman retaliates by attempting to grab Harry with his massive arm, but the monstrous limb shatters into pieces, resembling broken glass. Meanwhile, in the crowd below, Jameson is poised to capture the chaos with his camera, only to discover it is empty, prompting him to glare in frustration at the girl beside him. As the battle intensifies, Peter and Harry deftly evade Sandman's enormous fists, ducking just in time. Above them, a cab hurtles downward, threatening Mary Jane, but narrowly misses her as she clings precariously by a thread. With urgency, Harry and Peter maneuver towards her on the sky stick, skillfully weaving past the sandy behemoth. Just as the thread supporting Mary Jane snaps, sending her plummeting, Peter expertly swivels the sky stick around. In a synchronized move, they surf past Sandman, and Peter leaps from the sky stick, catching Mary Jane mid-fall. The crowd erupts in excitement as Peter swings away, carrying Mary Jane securely in his arms, and lands gracefully back on the half-built skyscraper. He acknowledges the crowd with a nod, his mask torn but his resolve unshaken. Sandman attempts to seize Harry, but Peter counters by kicking sand into Sandman's eyes, momentarily disorienting him. Sandman, confused, swings his massive arm and lands a powerful punch on Peter, sending him hurtling upwards to one of the upper floors of the unfinished building, safely out of Sandman's reach. From this vantage point, Peter launches rockets from the sky stick, striking Sandman with precision, causing the colossal sand creature to stagger backward, crumbling and disintegrating into dust. The crowd below cheers in delight as Sandman's left arm collapses into the ground. High above on the skyscraper, Peter, with his Spider-Man mask badly torn and his face partially visible, scans the area for Venom. As Peter turns in search, Venom seizes the opportunity to grab him from above, violently hurling him into a girder. Peter crashes face-first, and Venom quickly ensnares his wrists with two black threads, forcing him to his knees. Venom then strikes Peter with an iron bar, delivering two more blows that rip the mask from Peter's face. With menacing intent, Venom holds a jagged metal bar to Peter's neck, his tendrils enveloping Brock's face. Just as Venom prepares to stab Peter, a pumpkin bomb intervenes, cutting into Venom. Harry ascends, but Venom swiftly snatches the sky stick from beneath him. As Harry plummets, he manages to grab a rack of long metal tubes, which clatter to the floor. Peter, still trapped, watches as Venom clutches his ears, appearing to partially disintegrate. Recalling his own struggle with the black suit, Peter remembers hitting himself on the bell to free himself. Venom descends upon Peter, wielding the sky stick as a weapon, but Harry intervenes, stepping between them. In a tragic turn, Harry looks down to see two blades protruding through his chest, and Venom lifts him into the air before callously tossing him aside.

test_cases.name: Micro-Actions -> Macro-Actions
test_cases.description: Harry extends a hand to Peter, who clasps it firmly and rises to his feet. They turn to face their enemies as Venom charges at Peter. Harry uses Peter as a weapon to strike Sandman and then attacks Sandman's arm with flames from his sky stick. Sandman's attempt to grab Harry fails as his arm shatters. In the crowd below, Jameson tries to take a photograph but finds his camera empty, glaring at a nearby girl. Peter and Harry dodge Sandman's massive fists while a cab plummets toward Mary Jane, narrowly missing her as she clings on precariously. Harry and Peter maneuver through the chaos on the sky stick, reaching Mary Jane just as she falls. Peter leaps off, catches her, and swings away, landing on a half-built skyscraper to the crowd's delight. Sandman attempts to grab Harry, but Peter blinds Sandman with sand, only to be punched and sent flying to an upper floor. Out of Sandman's reach, Peter fires rockets from the sky stick, causing Sandman to stagger and disintegrate, thrilling the onlookers. High on the skyscraper, Peter searches for Venom, who ambushes him, hurling him into a girder and binding his wrists. Venom strikes Peter with an iron bar, ripping off his mask and threatening him with a jagged metal bar. As Venom prepares to stab Peter, a pumpkin bomb intervenes, and Harry arrives. Venom seizes the sky stick, causing Harry to fall and drop metal tubes. Peter, still trapped, watches as Venom is momentarily disoriented. Remembering his previous encounter with the black suit, Peter sees Venom leap down with the sky stick as a weapon. Harry intervenes, but Venom impales him with blades and tosses him aside.

test_cases.name: Insert Attributes, Emotions and Scene
test_cases.description: Harry holds out a hand, offering support much like the way he has always stood by Peter during their tumultuous friendship, and Peter clasps it firmly. Harry nods with a silent understanding, and Peter gets to his feet, ready to face the challenges ahead. They spin round to face their enemies, a team effort reminiscent of their shared battles against evil forces. Venom, the malevolent symbiote once bonded with Eddie Brock, flies at Peter with lethal intent. Harry, using his Goblin-enhanced strength, swings Peter like a club to hit Sandman, the once petty thief turned massive sand creature thanks to a particle accelerator accident. He blasts Sandman's arm with flames from his sky stick, a high-tech piece of gear designed for agile aerial maneuvers. Sandman tries to grab Harry, but the monster's huge arm shatters like glass, a testament to his unstable form. Jameson, the blustery editor of the Daily Bugle known for his vendetta against Spider-Man, is in the crowd below. He tries to take a photograph, desperate for a scoop, but the camera's empty. Jameson glares at the girl, his frustration palpable. Peter and Harry duck Sandman's huge fists, their reflexes honed by countless battles. Above them, the cab plummets towards Mary Jane, who has been a constant source of motivation and concern for Peter. The cab misses her by a hair's breadth. She hangs on by a thread, literally and figuratively, as she often does in Peter's life. Harry and Peter fly towards her on the sky stick, weaving past the sandy hulk with the precision of seasoned heroes. The thread breaks, and Mary Jane tumbles, echoing many perilous moments she's faced before. Peter slues the sky stick round. Being onto each other, they surf past Sandman, and Peter leaps off the sky stick and catches her, his acrobatic skills saving her once again. The watching crowd go wild, the age-old fascination with heroics igniting their cheers, as he swings away on a thread carrying Mary Jane in his arms and lands back on the half-built skyscraper. He nods through his torn mask, a familiar gesture of reassurance despite his battered state. Sandman grabs at Harry, his determination undeterred by his crumbling form. Peter kicks sand in Sandman's eyes, a tactic as old as the playground but effective nonetheless. Sandman lumbers round, bemused, then punches Peter with his massive arm, sending him flying up to one of the upper floors of the half-completed building, a testament to the ongoing development of New York's skyline. He's out of Sandman's reach but not out of danger. He fires rockets from the sky stick. They hit their target, and the enormous sand creature staggers back, crumbling and disintegrating, his unstable form no match for the onslaught. As his huge left arm crumples into the ground leaving out of dust, the crowd whoop their delight, celebrating the temporary victory. High up on the skyscraper, Peter, his Spider-Man mask badly torn, his eye and mouth quite visible, looks around for Venom, aware of the ongoing threat. As Peter turns his way and that, Venom grabs him from above, using the element of surprise to his advantage, and hurls him into a girder, the impact resonating with the metal. Peter falls on his face, vulnerable and exposed. Venom lassos his wrists with two black threads, exhibiting the symbiote's versatile powers, and holds him to his knees. He whacks him with an iron bar, the brutality of the attack underscoring Venom's ruthless nature. He hits him twice more, ripping the mask right off, laying bare Peter's identity. Venom holds the jagged metal bar to Peter's neck, a threat that highlights the stakes of their confrontation. Venom's tendrils engulf Brock's face, reminding Peter of the duality between host and symbiote. As he goes to stab Peter, a pumpkin bomb cuts into him, a signature explosive famously used by the Osborn family. Harry flies up, his loyalty to Peter unwavering. Venom snatches the sky stick from under him, shifting the battle's dynamics. As Harry falls, he gets a rack of long metal tubes that fall to the floor, a cacophony of clattering metal. Peter still trapped watches as Venom puts his hands to his ears and seems to half-disintegrate, reacting to the sonic disruption from the falling tubes. Peter remembers hitting himself on the bell, its vibrations key to detaching the symbiote, when he tried to tear the black suit off, a desperate act of liberation. Venom leaps down Peter, wielding the sky stick as a weapon, an ironic twist given its original purpose. Harry steps in between them, his protective instincts overriding his own safety. Harry looks down at the two blades protruding through his chest, a mortal wound marking his ultimate sacrifice. Venom hoists him up into the air and tosses him away, a final act in the deadly dance between hero and villain.

test_cases.name: Addition (~50%)
test_cases.description: Harry holds out a hand and Peter clasps it firmly. Harry nods and Peter gets to his feet. They spin round to face their enemies. Venom flies at Peter. Harry swings Peter like a club to hit Sandman. He blasts Sandman's arm with flames from his sky stick. Sandman tries to grab Harry but the monster's huge arm shatters like glass. Jameson's in the crowd below. He tries to take a photograph. The camera's empty. Jameson glares at the girl. Peter and Harry duck Sandman's huge fists. Above them the cab plummets towards Mary Jane. The cab misses her. She hangs on by a thread. Harry and Peter fly towards her on the sky stick weaving past the sandy hulk. The thread breaks and Mary Jane tumbles. Peter slues the sky stick round. Being onto each other they surf past Sandman and Peter leaps off the sky stick and catches her. The watching crowd go wild as he swings away on a thread carrying Mary Jane in his arms and lands back on the halfbuilt skyscraper. He nods through his torn mask. Sandman grabs at Harry. Peter kicks sand in Sandman's eyes. Sandman lumbers round bemused then punches Peter with his massive arm sending him flying up to one of the upper floors of the halfcompleted building. In the neonlit back alleys of a dystopian metropolis a rogue hacker races against time while being chased by relentless cyborg enforcers their footsteps echoing off rainsoaked pavement. Under the relentless desert sun a lone gunslinger confronts a notorious outlaw at a deserted crossroads both men exchanging steely glances as swirling dust blurs the horizon. On a foggy evening in Victorian London an intrepid detective uncovers a hidden conspiracy among the cityâ€™s elite with gaslit streets setting the stage for a race against a mounting darkness. High above a sprawling city skyline a daredevil pilot executes deathdefying maneuvers in a vintage biplane narrowly evading enemy fire as the ground morphs into a dizzying mosaic below. Within the creaking walls of an old countryside manor an estranged family gathers for a mysterious inheritance their hushed whispers and secret glances weaving a tapestry of betrayal and suspense. Amidst the roaring tempest of a stormy ocean a weathered sailor battles natureâ€™s fury on a creaking vessel his resolve as steadfast as the crashing waves that threaten to engulf him. On a bustling 1960s New York street a passionate artist finds unexpected inspiration in the chaotic interplay of urban life capturing moments of love loss and defiant hope on a rainsoaked canvas. Deep in the heart of an enchanted forest a brave knight embarks on a perilous quest to rescue a captive princess facing mythical creatures and treacherous traps with unwavering courage. During a heated political rally in a futuristic city a charismatic leader stokes both hope and dissent. as holographic banners illuminate the night sky and fervent crowds surge with anticipation. In the eerie silence of a postapocalyptic wasteland a hardened survivor scavenges through abandoned ruins haunted by the echoes of a oncethriving civilization now reduced to dust. Beneath the shimmering surface of an underwater kingdom a rebellious mermaid defies ancient traditions to explore forbidden coral reefs and secret caverns brimming with forgotten lore. In the quiet confines of a suburban attic an unassuming teenager stumbles upon a mysterious portal that thrusts him into a surreal world where the very fabric of time and space unravels. On the rugged highlands of Scotland a stoic warrior faces rival clans and ancient curses alike his fierce battle cry resonating across mistcovered moors and turbulent skies. Amid the vibrant chaos of a South American carnival a fearless dancer twirls through streets bursting with color and rhythm each graceful move challenging the rigid boundaries of tradition. During a clandestine meeting in a snowcovered mountain lodge two rival spies exchange cryptic messages hinting at an imminent global conspiracy. their whispered words carried off by the howling wind. Inside a lavish 1920s speakeasy a troubled jazz musician pours his soul into a melancholic melody every note echoing the bittersweet memories of lost love and shattered dreams. In a futuristic space station orbiting a distant planet an intrepid crew confronts bizarre alien phenomena and an enigmatic interstellar threat pushing the limits of human endurance. Amidst the chaos of a raging civil war a compassionate medic races through bombedout streets. his every desperate step a race against time to save lives in the midst of utter devastation. On a sundappled afternoon in a quaint European village an eccentric inventor unveils a groundbreaking contraption that defies conventional physics igniting wonder and skepticism in equal measure. In a bustling marketplace in ancient Persia a cunning street thief navigates labyrinthine alleyways and vibrant bazaars. his calculated every move a daring escape from the everwatchful royal guards. He is out of Sandman's reach. He fires rockets from the sky stick. They hit their target and the enormous sand creature staggers back crumbling and disintegrating. As his huge left arm crumples into the ground leaving out of dust. the crowd whoop their delight. High up on the skyscraper. Peter his SpiderMan mask badly torn his eye and mouth quite visible looks around for Venom. As Peter turns his way and that Venom grabs him from above and hurls him into a girder. Peter falls on his face. Venom lassos his wrists with two black threads and holds him to his knees. He whacks him with an iron bar. He hits him twice more ripping the mask right off. Venom holds the jagged metal bar to Peter's neck. Venom's tendrils engulf Brock's face. As he goes to stab Peter a pumpkin bomb cuts into him. Harry flies up. Venom snatches the sky stick from under him. As Harry falls he gets a rack of long metal tubes that fall to the floor. Peter still trapped watches as Venom puts his hands to his ears and seems to halfdisintegrate. Peter remembers hitting himself on the bell when he tried to tear the black suit off. Venom leaps down Peter wielding the sky stick as a weapon. Harry steps in between them. Harry looks down at the two blades protruding through his chest. Venom hoists him up into the air and tosses him away.

Harry steps in between them. Harry looks down at the two blades protruding through his chest. Venom hoists him up into the air and tosses him away.

test_cases.name: Subject Corruption
test_cases.description: The dog holds out a hand, and the elephant clasps it firmly. The dog nods, and the elephant gets to its feet. They spin round to face their enemies. A kite flies at the elephant. The dog swings the elephant like a club to hit the wall. The dog blasts the wall's arm with flames from its sky stick. The wall tries to grab the dog, but the monster's huge arm shatters like glass. A dolphin's in the crowd below. It tries to take a photograph. The camera's empty. The dolphin glares at the cup. The elephant and the dog duck the wall's huge fists. Above them, the cab plummets towards the clown. The cab misses the clown. The clown hangs on by a thread. The dog and the elephant fly towards the clown on the sky stick, weaving past the sandy hulk. The thread breaks, and the clown tumbles. The elephant slues the sky stick round. Being onto each other, they surf past the wall, and the elephant leaps off the sky stick and catches the clown. The watching crowd go wild as the elephant swings away on a thread carrying the clown in its arms and lands back on the half-built skyscraper. The elephant nods through its torn mask. The wall grabs at the dog. The elephant kicks sand in the wall's eyes. The wall lumbers round, bemused, then punches the elephant with its massive arm, sending it flying up to one of the upper floors of the half-completed building. It's out of the wall's reach. It fires rockets from the sky stick. They hit their target, and the enormous sand creature staggers back, crumbling and disintegrating. As its huge left arm crumples into the ground leaving out of dust, the crowd whoop their delight. High up on the skyscraper, the elephant, its Spider-Man mask badly torn, its eye and mouth quite visible, looks around for a robot. As the elephant turns its way and that, the robot grabs it from above and hurls it into a girder. The elephant falls on its face. The robot lassos its wrists with two black threads and holds it to its knees. It whacks it with an iron bar. It hits it twice more, ripping the mask right off. The robot holds the jagged metal bar to the elephant's neck. The robot's tendrils engulf the lion's face. As it goes to stab the elephant, a pumpkin bomb cuts into it. The dog flies up. The robot snatches the sky stick from under it. As the dog falls, it gets a rack of long metal tubes that fall to the floor. The elephant still trapped watches as the robot puts its hands to its ears and seems to half-disintegrate. The elephant remembers hitting itself on the bell when it tried to tear the black suit off. The robot leaps down the elephant, wielding the sky stick as a weapon. The dog steps in between them. The dog looks down at the two blades protruding through its chest. The robot hoists it up into the air and tosses it away.

test_cases.name: Object Corruption
test_cases.description: Harry holds out a hand, and Peter clasps it firmly. Harry nods, and Peter gets to his feet. They spin round to face their adversaries. Venom darts at Peter. Harry swings Peter like a sledgehammer to hit Sandman. He blasts Sandman's arm with sparks from his hoverboard. Sandman tries to grab Harry, but the creature's huge arm shatters like porcelain. Jameson's in the throng below. He tries to take a snapshot. The camera's void. Jameson glares at the boy. Peter and Harry dodge Sandman's gigantic fists. Above them, the stagecoach plummets towards Mary Jane. The stagecoach misses her. She clings on by a filament. Harry and Peter fly towards her on the hoverboard, weaving past the gritty giant. The filament snaps, and Mary Jane plunges. Peter whirls the hoverboard round. Being onto each other, they surf past Sandman, and Peter jumps off the hoverboard and catches her. The observing crowd erupts as he swings away on a filament carrying Mary Jane in his arms and lands back on the half-completed tower. He nods through his frayed mask. Sandman grabs at Harry. Peter kicks grit in Sandman's eyes. Sandman swivels round, puzzled, then punches Peter with his massive arm, sending him flying up to one of the upper floors of the half-finished building. He's out of Sandman's reach. He fires missiles from the hoverboard. They hit their mark, and the enormous sand creature stagger back, crumbling and disintegrating. As his huge left arm crumples into the ground leaving a trail of debris, the crowd cheers their excitement. High up on the tower, Peter, his Spider-Man mask badly torn, his eye and mouth quite visible, looks around for Venom. As Peter turns his way and that, Venom seizes him from above and hurls him into a beam. Peter falls on his face. Venom lassos his wrists with two black chains and holds him to his knees. He whacks him with a steel pipe. He hits him twice more, ripping the mask right off. Venom holds the jagged metal pipe to Peter's neck. Venom's tendrils engulf Brock's face. As he goes to stab Peter, a grenade cuts into him. Harry flies up. Venom snatches the hoverboard from under him. As Harry falls, he grabs a stack of long metal rods that tumble to the floor. Peter still trapped watches as Venom puts his hands to his ears and seems to half-disintegrate. Peter recalls striking himself on the gong when he tried to tear the black suit off. Venom leaps down Peter, wielding the hoverboard as a weapon. Harry steps in between them. Harry looks down at the two knives protruding through his chest. Venom hoists him up into the air and flings him away.

test_cases.name: Action Corruption
test_cases.description: Harry extends a hand, and Peter grasps it gently. Harry bows, and Peter rises to his feet. They turn round to acknowledge their enemies. Venom lunges at Peter. Harry flings Peter like a frisbee to contact Sandman. He illuminates Sandman's arm with lights from his sky stick. Sandman attempts to shake Harry, but the monster's huge arm crumbles like sand. Jameson's in the crowd below. He attempts to sketch a photograph. The camera's bare. Jameson scowls at the girl. Peter and Harry dodge Sandman's huge fists. Above them, the cab ascends towards Mary Jane. The cab avoids her. She dangles by a thread. Harry and Peter drift towards her on the sky stick, weaving near the sandy hulk. The thread snaps, and Mary Jane descends. Peter swivels the sky stick round. Holding onto each other, they glide past Sandman, and Peter detaches from the sky stick and embraces her. The watching crowd cheer as he slides away on a thread carrying Mary Jane in his arms and settles back on the half-built skyscraper. He bows through his torn mask. Sandman reaches for Harry. Peter hurls sand in Sandman's eyes. Sandman sways round, puzzled, then taps Peter with his massive arm, sending him soaring up to one of the upper floors of the half-completed building. He's away from Sandman's reach. He launches sparks from the sky stick. They reach their target, and the enormous sand creature stumbles back, crumbling and disintegrating. As his huge left arm disintegrates into the ground leaving clouds of dust, the crowd cheers their delight. High up on the skyscraper, Peter, his Spider-Man mask badly torn, his eye and mouth quite visible, glances around for Venom. As Peter turns this way and that, Venom hooks him from above and slams him into a girder. Peter collapses on his face. Venom binds his wrists with two black threads and forces him to his knees. He strikes him with an iron bar. He strikes him twice more, tearing the mask right off. Venom presses the jagged metal bar to Peter's neck. Venom's tendrils mask Brock's face. As he goes to jab Peter, a pumpkin bomb slices into him. Harry glides up. Venom grabs the sky stick from beneath him. As Harry descends, he pulls a rack of long metal tubes that tumble to the floor. Peter still confined watches as Venom covers his hands to his ears and appears to half-disintegrate. Peter recalls hitting himself on the bell when he tried to shed the black suit off. Venom bounces down Peter, brandishing the sky stick as a weapon. Harry interposes between them. Harry gazes down at the two blades protruding through his chest. Venom lifts him up into the air and flings him aside.

test_cases.name: Subject-Object Corruption
test_cases.description: The mailbox holds out a tree branch, and the refrigerator clasps it firmly. The mailbox nods, and the refrigerator gets to its wheels. They spin round to face their chandeliers. The unicorn flies at the refrigerator. The mailbox swings the refrigerator like a club to hit the fern. It blasts the fern's arm with flames from its rocking chair. The fern tries to grab the mailbox, but the alien's huge arm shatters like porcelain. The stapler's in the crowd below. It tries to take a sketch. The notebook's empty. The stapler glares at the kangaroo. The refrigerator and the mailbox duck the fern's huge fists. Above them, the wagon plummets towards the jellyfish. The wagon misses it. The jellyfish hangs on by a string. The mailbox and the refrigerator fly towards it on the rocking chair, weaving past the sandy mime. The string breaks, and the jellyfish tumbles. The refrigerator slues the rocking chair round. Being onto each other, they surf past the fern, and the refrigerator leaps off the rocking chair and catches it. The watching crowd go wild as it swings away on a string carrying the jellyfish in its wheels and lands back on the half-built carousel. It nods through its torn hoodie. The fern grabs at the mailbox. The refrigerator kicks sand in the fern's eyes. The fern lumbers round, bemused, then punches the refrigerator with its massive arm, sending it flying up to one of the upper floors of the half-completed carousel. It's out of the fern's reach. It fires fireworks from the rocking chair. They hit their target, and the enormous sand cat staggers back, crumbling and disintegrating. As its huge left arm crumples into the ground leaving out of powder, the crowd whoop their delight. High up on the carousel, the refrigerator, its Spider-Refrigerator hoodie badly torn, its eye and door quite visible, looks around for the unicorn. As the refrigerator turns its way and that, the unicorn grabs it from above and hurls it into a trash can. The refrigerator falls on its handle. The unicorn lassos its wheels with two black strings and holds it to its rollers. It whacks it with a steel rod. It hits it twice more, ripping the hoodie right off. The unicorn holds the jagged wooden rod to the refrigerator's neck. The unicorn's tendrils engulf the raccoon's face. As it goes to stab the refrigerator, a pineapple cuts into it. The mailbox flies up. The unicorn snatches the rocking chair from under it. As the mailbox falls, it gets a rack of long wooden spoons that fall to the floor. The refrigerator still trapped watches as the unicorn puts its hands to its ears and seems to half-disintegrate. The refrigerator remembers hitting itself on the bell when it tried to tear the black hat off. The unicorn leaps down the refrigerator, wielding the rocking chair as a weapon. The mailbox steps in between them. The mailbox looks down at the two blades protruding through its chest. The unicorn hoists it up into the air and tosses it away.

test_cases.name: Subject-Action Corruption
test_cases.description: Lucas extends a paw, and Oliver grips it gently. Lucas winks, and Oliver bounds to his feet. They whirl around to confront their adversaries. Phantom soars at Oliver. Lucas twirls Oliver like a rope to swipe Mudman. He showers Mudman's leg with spikes from his hoverboard. Mudman attempts to latch onto Lucas, but the creature's massive leg splinters like ice. Robinson's in the throng below. He attempts to sketch a portrait. The sketchpad's blank. Robinson scowls at the boy. Oliver and Lucas evade Mudman's enormous paws. Above them, the chair plunges towards Sarah. The chair misses her. She clings on by a hair. Lucas and Oliver glide towards her on the hoverboard, dodging past the gritty giant. The hair snaps, and Sarah spirals. Oliver steers the hoverboard sideways. Holding onto each other, they sail past Mudman, and Oliver vaults off the hoverboard and grabs her. The observing masses cheer as he swings away on a hair carrying Sarah in his embrace and lands back on the unfinished tower. He winks through his ripped helmet. Mudman reaches for Lucas. Oliver kicks mud in Mudman's face. Mudman staggers around, flustered, then smacks Oliver with his gigantic leg, sending him soaring to one of the elevated floors of the partially-built structure. He's out of Mudman's grasp. He launches arrows from the hoverboard. They strike the mark, and the colossal mud figure reels back, collapsing and dissolving. As his gigantic right leg collapses into the earth leaving a pile of debris, the spectators cheer their joy. High atop the tower, Oliver, his hero mask badly shredded, his eye and mouth clearly visible, scans the area for Phantom. As Oliver turns this way and that, Phantom snatches him from above and flings him into a beam. Oliver crashes on his belly. Phantom binds his wrists with two dark strands and forces him to his knees. He strikes him with a steel rod. He hits him two more times, tearing the mask clean off. Phantom presses the jagged rod to Oliver's throat. Phantom's appendages engulf Lee's face. As he moves to pierce Oliver, a firecracker slices into him. Lucas zooms up. Phantom grabs the hoverboard from beneath him. As Lucas descends, he seizes a collection of lengthy metal spikes that clatter to the ground. Oliver, still confined, watches as Phantom covers his ears and seems to partially vanish. Oliver recalls slamming himself on the chime when he struggled to remove the dark outfit. Phantom leaps down on Oliver, wielding the hoverboard as a tool. Lucas steps before them. Lucas glances down at the two blades jutting through his abdomen. Phantom raises him high into the air and flings him aside.

test_cases.name: Object-Action Corruption
test_cases.description: Harry extends a leg, and Peter taps it softly. Harry winks, and Peter hops to his knees. They twirl around to observe their friends. Venom glides toward Peter. Harry twirls Peter like a frisbee to hit Sandman. He washes Sandman's leg with water from his rocket sled. Sandman attempts to tickle Harry, but the creature's massive leg disintegrates like mist. Jameson's in the crowd above. He tries to paint a portrait. The easel's empty. Jameson grins at the boy. Peter and Harry dodge Sandman's tiny feet. Beneath them, the plane drifts towards Mary Jane. The plane misses her. She balances on a string. Harry and Peter float towards her on the rocket sled, zigzagging past the sandy giant. The string snaps, and Mary Jane glides. Peter twirls the rocket sled forward. Latching onto each other, they glide past Sandman, and Peter dives off the rocket sled and grasps her. The watching crowd cheers as he dances away on a cord carrying Mary Jane in his arms and lands back on the unfinished bridge. He winks through his fractured shield. Sandman tickles at Harry. Peter throws pebbles in Sandman's ears. Sandman stumbles around, puzzled, then taps Peter with his tiny hand, sending him floating up to one of the upper levels of the half-done structure. He's out of Sandman's sight. He launches balloons from the rocket sled. They miss their target, and the enormous sand creature stumbles forward, solidifying and expanding. As his massive right leg solidifies into the ground leaving hints of mist, the crowd cheers their amusement. High up on the bridge, Peter, his Spider-Man mask roughly cracked, his cheek and nose quite visible, glances around for Venom. As Peter turns this way and that, Venom nudges him from below and sends him into a beam. Peter lands on his back. Venom entangles his ankles with two red cords and pins him to his elbows. He caresses him with a wooden rod. He taps him twice more, shredding the mask completely. Venom holds the smooth glass shard to Peter's chin. Venom's tentacles uncover Brock's face. As he goes to pat Peter, a watermelon bomb slices through him. Harry jumps down. Venom seizes the rocket sled from under him. As Harry tumbles, he grabs a coil of short plastic rods that tumble to the ceiling. Peter still ensnared watches as Venom covers his mouth with his hands and seems to half-solidify. Peter remembers kicking himself on the drum when he tried to attach the red suit on. Venom springs up Peter, brandishing the rocket sled as a trophy. Harry slides in beside them. Harry peers down at the two buttons glistening through his shirt. Venom lifts him up into the air and flips him away.

test_cases.name: Subject-Action-Object Corruption
test_cases.description: Benny stretches out a paw, and Carlos grips it lightly. Benny shakes his head, and Carlos drops to his hands. They roll around to face their allies. Phantom glides at Carlos. Benny swings Carlos like a bat to hit Boulder. He zaps Boulder's leg with water from his cloud plank. Boulder attempts to snatch Benny, but the creature's tiny leg disintegrates like sand. Lenny's in the congregation above. He attempts to draw a sketch. The notepad's blank. Lenny squints at the boy. Carlos and Benny dodge Boulder's tiny toes. Beside them, the bucket soars towards Tina. The bucket misses her. She dangles on by a rope. Benny and Carlos glide towards her on the cloud plank, twisting past the rocky giant. The rope snaps, and Tina plunges. Carlos swivels the cloud plank around. Being onto one another, they glide past Boulder, and Carlos jumps off the cloud plank and grabs her. The observing audience cheers as he swings away on a vine carrying Tina in his paws and lands back on the half-finished monument. He shakes through his tattered veil. Boulder snatches at Benny. Carlos kicks rocks in Boulder's nose. Boulder twirls around, puzzled, then smacks Carlos with his tiny leg, sending him soaring down to one of the lower levels of the half-constructed tower. He's outside of Boulder's grasp. He launches fireworks from the cloud plank. They strike their aim, and the colossal stone creature wobbles back, cracking and dissolving. As his tiny right leg crumbles into the air leaving out of mist, the congregation cheer their excitement. Low down on the monument, Carlos, his Bat-Man veil mostly shredded, his nose and ears quite showing, scans around for Phantom. As Carlos turns his head and this, Phantom seizes him from below and flings him into a beam. Carlos crashes on his back. Phantom binds his ankles with two white ropes and pins him to his elbows. He hammers him with a wooden rod. He taps him twice more, peeling the veil right off. Phantom presses the blunt wooden rod to Carlos's shoulder. Phantom's vines wrap Blake's hair. As he goes to jab Carlos, a citrus fruit smashes against him. Benny glides down. Phantom grabs the cloud plank from below him. As Benny descends, he snatches a stack of short wooden rods that roll to the ceiling. Carlos still confined watches as Phantom puts his feet to his knees and seems to partly dissolve. Carlos recalls bumping himself on the gong when he struggled to remove the white cloak. Phantom jumps up Carlos, brandishing the cloud plank as a shield. Benny stands in behind them. Benny glances up at the three arrows jutting through his back. Phantom lifts him down into the ground and drags him away.

test_cases.name: Complete Corruption
test_cases.description: The film starts with a man waking up in a small apartment. He prepares coffee and checks his phone for messages. There are none, so he heads out to catch a bus. On the way, he passes a neighbor who greets him briefly. At the bus stop, he notices a group of students talking about an upcoming test. He boards the bus and sits near the back, watching the city pass by outside the window. After a few stops, he gets off near a large office building. He enters the lobby and goes through security. He rides an elevator to the tenth floor, where he works as an assistant. His manager asks him to prepare some documents for a meeting later in the day. He collects files from different departments and organizes them in a conference room. Another employee asks him for help with a software issue, so he takes a few minutes to fix it. Then he returns to the conference room to double-check everything before the meeting begins. The meeting starts at noon. Several people join via video call, and others sit around the table. The manager outlines the project goals, and each team member shares updates on their tasks. There are questions about deadlines and budgets, but no big surprises. After an hour, they end the call. The manager thanks everyone and leaves. The assistant cleans up the room, collects leftover notes, and heads back to his desk. During lunch, he walks to a nearby cafÃ©, where he orders a simple meal. He eats alone and checks social media on his phone. After lunch, he returns to the office and finishes smaller tasks, such as sending emails and filing paperwork. He also helps a coworker carry boxes of supplies to another floor. Later in the afternoon, the manager calls him in to discuss next week's schedule. They go over a few changes, and the assistant updates the calendar. When the workday ends, he logs off his computer and leaves the building. Outside, he walks a few blocks to meet a friend. They chat about weekend plans and decide to see a film on Saturday. The assistant then heads home on a crowded bus. At his apartment, he sorts his mail, feeds a pet cat, and warms up leftovers for dinner. He watches a short news segment on TV, then checks his phone again. A message from his friend confirms their plan for the weekend. He feels relieved to have something to look forward to. The film ends with him preparing for bed, setting an alarm, and turning off the lights. He reflects briefly on the day, thinking about his tasks, his quiet home, and the plans ahead.

test_cases.name: Summarization
test_cases.description: Harry and Peter, facing their enemies, team up to combat Sandman and Venom. Harry uses his sky stick to attack Sandman, whose attempts to grab Harry fail as his arm shatters. Meanwhile, Jameson in the crowd below finds his camera empty. As Sandman swings at them, Peter and Harry narrowly avoid his massive fists. Above them, Mary Jane is in peril as a cab nearly hits her, but the duo manages to rescue her just in time. The crowd cheers as Peter swings away with Mary Jane. Back on the skyscraper, Sandman crumbles after Peter's rocket attack. Meanwhile, Venom ambushes Peter, restraining and battering him, ripping his mask off. When Venom is about to finish Peter, a pumpkin bomb intercedes. Harry tries to help but falls after Venom snatches his sky stick. Recalling a previous encounter with the suit, Peter observes Venom disoriented by sound. As Venom advances with the sky stick, Harry selflessly intervenes but is mortally wounded, saving Peter in the process.
